creator: Erich.Meier@methodpark.de
text:
I discovered that Tomcat 4.1.X (opposed to 4.0.X) does not follow any symbolic 
link at all.

My app uses symlinked jsps as well as symlinked tlds and jars.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
This is a likely side effect of some security tightening which has been done on
the file back end, and which is designed to disallow any kind of access outside
of the webapp root folder (it works by checking if the absolute canonicalized
path of the resource starts with the canonicalized base path of the webapp).

If you want to disable this, you can use your own custom implementation of the
directory context, like the one which ships with 4.0.4.

This also occurs when you have a dir structure like :-

WEB-INF/tlds/myTaglib.tld

In Web.xml

<...
  <taglib-location>tlds/myTaglib.tld</taglib-location>
..>

I get =>
Exception processing TLD at resource path /WEB-INF/web.xml/../tlds/mtTaglib.tld
